Thin-section computed tomography (CT) through the nodule is the next best step in the diagnostic evaluation as it provides more detailed information about the size, shape, and location of the nodule, as well as any associated features such as calcification or vascular invasion. PET scan may be used if malignancy is suspected and CT-guided transthoracic needle aspiration (TTNA) or Transbronchial needle aspiration (TBNA) may be considered if the nodule is suspicious for malignancy on CT.
